text:
Can anyone explain what group.header is intended to be?
<https://spin.d.pr/s1QecJ+>
Iâ€™ve always felt it was really misleading as under settings, blog header is the name of the field <https://spin.d.pr/xVbCNM+>

Also can we get the label changed from Blog Header to Public Title?

It just makes sense. if the code and everything is meant for it to be that way.
Is there a way to find a certain widget under the `{{all_widgets}}` hubl?
I am basically trying to see if a widget exists on the page but the problem is the widget falls under the `all_widgets` area
so for `attr='attribute_name'` which I am looking to grab? This particular filter always confuses me.

last random question, what was the syntax for calling custom modules inside of each other, for example, can I call another custom module inside of another custom module using this `{% custom_widget "unique_name_for_custom_module" widget_name='Internal name of custom module (the name of module in Design Manager)', label='In-app label of custom module (what the user will see in the content editor)' %}`
Actually, looks like you cant use `custom_widget` in the new CM's

correct, you can't. Its like when you call a custom field created with hubL (`boolean`, `text`...) inside the CM. It will have a forced `overrideable=false` property (or maybe they just deactivated as the `import` function, don't really remember)

didn't tested but maybe you can do the trick with another html file calling the second CM inside a macro. Then you load the html in the layout env. and use the macro inside the first CM. I guess it won't work but maybe deserve a try
